roleset.name: location
roleset.note: PUT-V NOTES: Member of Vncls put-9.1-2. (from put.01-v)

roles.note: Because of the range of possible prepositions introducing thedestination, I decided that they should all be lumped under a LOC tag,rather than the usual practice of stripping out the preps from the PP. (from put.01-v)

example.name: heheh, he said 'onus'
example.text: Wilder has put the onus on Cole.

example.name: put your money where your mouth is
example.text: Japanese companies often put their money behind odd projects.

example.name: genie in the bottle
example.text: It's too late *trace* to put the genie back in the bottle.

example.name: no utterance?
example.text: As Dorothy Arighi puts it, blah blah blah

example.name: manner, not attribute
example.text: Let's put it bluntly.

roleset.name: result, attributive
roleset.note: PUT-V NOTES: No Vncls. Updated by Julia, 10/2010. (from put.03-v)

example.name: state to be
example.text: The pilots put the amount as high as $100 million.

example.name: putting it all together
example.text: [That fund]-1 was put *trace*-1 together by Blackstone Group.

example.name: another example
example.text: Increasing labor costs , Mr. Tyszkiewicz argued , would only put the countries at a further disadvantage in competing in the barrier - free EC market planned for after 1992 .
example.arg: at a further disadvantage in competing in the barrier - free EC market planned for after 1992

example.name: Arg0 rel Arg1
example.text: Many salarymen put in unproductive overtime hours.

example.name: valuable advice
example.text: Never *t* put off for tomorrow what you can put off to the day after that.
example.arg: what you can put off to the day after that

example.name: well, I never!
example.text: Japanese investors are put off by American exuberance.

example.name: like the emperor and his new clothes?1
example.text: The occasional Englishman puts on airs.

example.name: produce or stage
example.text: We put on instructional demonstrations to show you how to make best use of your purchases.
example.arg: to show you how to make best use of your purchases.

example.name: oh, the hardship!
example.text: Smokers must put out their cigarettes before entering the building.

roleset.name: disseminate, put out, produce
roleset.note: OUTPUT-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to put.10. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from output.01-n)

example.name: bedtime reading
example.text: John put out a report about PAS tagging.

example.name: Both args
example.text: Canadian oil output

example.name: arg 0 only
example.text: His output

example.name: arg 1 only
example.text: output of the poison gases

example.name: output-v
example.text: When you-1 use the OutputTo action or method *PRO*-1 to output a report to another format, you receive one of the following errors:

example.name: output-n
example.text: Although it is likely the interviewer will react to the model's output of (6), the algorithm must be prepared for the possibility that he will change the topic.

roleset.name: cause inconvenience or discomfort
roleset.note: PUT_OUT-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from put.14-v)
PUT_OUT-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from put.14-j)

example.name: All args
example.text: To make one of them stumble' {trKavSaKl^iv) is to perplex him, *PRO* to put him out about Christ, to create misunderstanding and estrangement, such as we hear of for a time in the case of the Baptist

example.name: adjectival
example.text: Amazingly , other nearby nations -LRB- Indonesia for one -RRB- are a bit put out as it extends Australian soverienty well into Sth East Asia .
example.arg: other nearby nations -LRB- Indonesia for one -RRB-
as it extends Australian soverienty well into Sth East Asia

example.name: cash
example.text: Few banks will put up new money for New Zealand.

example.name: they pretty much all look like this
example.text: Even with mutual funds, [the little investor]-1 continues *trace*-1 to put up with high fees, high commissions and poor performance, while index-fund managers slowly amass a better record with lower fees, lower commissions and less risk.
example.arg: with high fees , high commissions and poor performance

example.text: [They]-1 had until 1 May 1931 *-1 to put up the building.

roleset.name: idiomatic: hard put
roleset.note: HARD_PUT-V NOTES: "hard put" is an adjective and should not be tagged as a verb. We would be hard put *trace=we* to call it a game. (from put.04-v)

example.name: Japanese besuboru
example.text: ...the Beatles give way to baseball, in the Nipponese version we-2 would be hard put [*-2] to call a ``game.''

roleset.name: put_down: insult, demean, devalue
roleset.note: PUT_DOWN-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from put.15-v)

example.name: Args 0, 1
example.text: I mean look at them , every time they lose and election they-9 go on a rampage *PRO*-9 putting down the liberals wanting another vote , and when they get the vote , when do they decide to have it , right when people want to have a nice holiday , now we have to listen to the Conservatives complain about the liberals , and the liberals try to win the elections .

roleset.name: euthanize
roleset.note: PUT_DOWN-V NOTES: Added by Julia for google.

role.descr: Agent, entity responsible for decision to euthanize

example.name: put_down-v
example.text: Today we had to put our dog down.
